title: Multivariable Calculus Blended Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Single-Variable Calculus and Basic Concepts of Linear Algebra
context.additional_context: Blended learning design to enhance understanding of multivariable calculus concepts in smartphone-based limited-technology environments. Measures learning outcomes through project-based assessment, focusing on cognitive load management and strengthening mathematical thinking skills

learning_goals: Learners can solve real-world problems by applying partial differentiation, multiple integration, and vector field theory of multivariable functions
Learners can structure complex calculus concepts by combining asynchronous learning materials and face-to-face sessions provided via mobile platforms
Learners can produce outcomes that visually represent multivariable calculus theories or apply them to real-world cases through project-based assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
